Object.Name: Cellular Network and Bearer Control
Object.Description1: This LwM2M Object enables monitoring of available network bearers (or Radio Access Technologies - RATs) of cellular networks. Each instance of this Object holds information related to one network bearer incl. the associated PLMN. An object instance should be created for every RAT available for a PLMN, and for every PLMN visible to the device. The Object also allows steering the device towards a particular PLMN, or, to a particular PLMN+RAT combination.

Item.Name: MCC
Item.Description: Serving Mobile Country Code. As specified in TS [3GPP 23.003].

Item.Name: MNC
Item.Description: Mobile Network Code. As specified in TS [3GPP 23.003].

Item.Name: Network Bearer
Item.Description: Indicates the available network bearers. More specifically: 0: GSM 1: TD-SCDMA 2: WCDMA 3: CDMA2000 4: WiMAX 5: LTE-TDD 6: LTE-FDD 7: NB-IoT 8: 5GNR TDD 9: 5G-NR FDD 10: CAT-M 11 - 20: Reserved for other types of cellular network bearers

Item.Name: Currently In Use
Item.Description: Indicates if this PLMN and network bearer is currently used e.g. for the current LwM2M communication (true).

Item.Name: Radio Signal Strength
Item.Description: Indicates the average value of the received signal strength indication. The value is expressed in dBm. For the following network bearers the signal strength parameters indicated below are represented by this resource: GSM: RSSI UMTS: RSCP LTE: RSRP NB-IoT: NRSRP CAT-M: RSRP For more details on Network Measurement Report, refer to the appropriate 3GPP standards, (e.g. for LTE refer to 3GPP TS 36.133).

Item.Name: Link Quality
Item.Description: This contains received link quality e.g. RxQual Downlink for GSM (range 0...7, refer to 3GPP TS 44.018 for more details on Network Measurement Report encoding), RSRQ for LTE and Cat-M (refer to 3GPP TS 36.214), NRSRQ for NB-IoT (refer to 3GPP TS 36.214).

Item.Name: SignalSNR
Item.Description: SINR: Signal to Interference plus Noise Ratio SINR is the ratio of the strength of the received signal to the strength of the received interference signal (noise and interference).

Item.Name: Coverage Enhancement Level
Item.Description: Indicates the Coverage Enhancement Level of the UE in the serving cell. The Coverage Enhancement levels are defined and specified in 3GPP TS 36.331 and 36.213. 0: Coverage Enhancement level 0 1: Coverage Enhancement level 1 2: Coverage Enhancement level 2 3: Coverage Enhancement level 3 99: No Coverage Enhancement in the serving cell

Item.Name: Select Network
Item.Description: Move to the network represented by this Object Instance. Only the network is selected and the Bearer selection is performed automatically. Device sets “network manually selected” = 1.

Item.Name: Select Network And Bearer
Item.Description: Move to the network and bearer represented by this Object Instance. Device sets “network manually selected” = 1 Device sets “bearer manually selected” = 1

Item.Name: Device Supports Manual Network Selection
Item.Description:
0=device does not support manual network selection (overwriting automatic network selection) 1=device supports manual network selection
This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

Item.Name: Network Manually Selected
Item.Description:
0 = device is on automatic network selection mode. 1= device is on manual network selection mode and the network has been manually selected
This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

Item.Name: Device Supports Manual Bearer Selection
Item.Description:
0=device does not support manual bearer selection (overwriting automatic bearer selection) 1=device supports manual bearer selection
This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

Item.Name: Bearer Manually Selected
Item.Description:
0 = device is on automatic bearer selection mode.
1= device is on manual bearer selection mode and the bearer has been manually selected
This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

Item.Name: Perform Network Scan
Item.Description:
Perform a new network scan and populate the object instances accordingly.
This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

Item.Name: Reset Network Selection
Item.Description:
Resets the device to automated network selection. Additionally, sets the “network manually selected” = 0 and sets the “Bearer manually selected” = 0.
This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.
